did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Stanford University, Undergraduate Research Award Nominee theses
did.abstract: Collection includes honors theses and research projects nominated for three undergraduate research awards including the Firestone Medals for Excellence in Undergraduate Research, the Robert M. Golden Medals for Excellence in Humanities and Creative Arts, and the David M. Kennedy Honors Thesis Prizes.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 48 hours in advance of intended use. No photocopies may be made.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creators for materials they have authored or otherwise produced. Transmission or reproduction of materials requires the written permission of the copyright owner.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Stanford University, Undergraduate Research Awards Nominee theses (SC1191). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Firestone Medals for Excellence in Undergraduate Research recognizes graduating seniors nominated by their academic programs or departments for undertaking honors projects in engineering and the social, physical and natural sciences.

The Robert M. Golden Medals for Excellence in Humanities and Creative Arts recognizes students completing honors projects in the humanities or creative projects in the fine arts. The Golden Medal is awarded to the top ten percent of all honors theses in the humanities, senior projects or performance in the arts.

The Kenedy prize is given annually for outstanding honors theses in the humanities, social sciences, natural sciences and engineering. Recipients of this award have accomplished significantly advanced research in the field and have demonstrated strong potential for publication in peer-reviewed scholarly works. The prize was established in recognition of David M. Kennedy, professor emeritus of history, and faculty co-director of Stanford's Bill Lane Center for the American West, and his longstanding commitment to mentoring undergraduate writers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection includes honors theses and research projects nominated for three undergraduate research awards including the Firestone Medals for Excellence in Undergraduate Research, the Robert M. Golden Medals for Excellence in Humanities and Creative Arts, and the David M. Kennedy Honors Thesis Prizes.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.subject: David M. Kennedy Honors Thesis Prize
Firestone Medals for Excellence in Undergraduate Research
Robert M. Golden Medals for Excellence in Humanities and Creative Arts

did.unittitle: Nominated theses and honors projects
2012 Nominees
Bennet, Brittany, Elegy. (Golden)
Bleaman, Isaac, Vernacularity and authenticity in Sholem Aleichem's monologues: A variationist approach. (Golden)
Chan, Stephanie, The Waizhou Special: Exploring the effects of immigrant diffusion on Chinese restaurant workers in McMinnville, Tennessee. (Firestone, Kennedy)
Clark, Alexandra, Compassion at play: Cultivating compassion through theater with the fourth and fifth graders of Costano Elementary School. (Kennedy)
Dang, Vanessa Marie, Glutamine metabolism is a compenent of MYC associated oncogene addiction in renal adenocarcinoma. (Kennedy, Firestone)
Feehan, Ross, Helping those who harm: Harmonizing the practice of ethics and aquaculture insurance in China. (Firestone)
Gray, Colin, Responding to the monetary superpower: investigating the behavioral spillovers of U.S. monetary policy. (Kennedy, Firestone)
Holtzman, Alexander, The unanticipated inequalities of electoral reform: Racial and ethnic disparities in voting behavior under Oakland's ranked choice voting program. (Firestone)
Ibarra, Daniel Enrique, An assessment of late Pleistocene to Middle Holocene lake level fluctuations in Surprise Valley, California. (Kennedy, Firestone)
Kotzin, Jonathan J., The role of CD4+ T cells in the development of protective immunity to 2009 pandemic H1N1 influenza. (Kennedy, Firestone)
Nichols, Samara, Does infant directed speech facilitate familiar word recognition by 14- to 15-month olds? (Golden)
Poland, Susannah, The secret lives of beads: tracing the histories of beaded body adornment among the Chagga people of northern Tanzania. (Firestone)
Reid, Otis, Monitoring, expropriating, and interfering: concentrated ownership, government holdings, and firm value on the Ghana Stock Exchange. (Kennedy)
Tuan, Eric, Beyond cadence: post-cadential extensions and Josquin's compositional style. (Golden)
Weber, Sadie, Assessing the role of wild plant taxa in predomestication cultivation during the pre pottery Neolithic A. (Firestone, Golden, Kennedy)
2013 nominees
Katsma, Holst, Problems of loudness in the novel. (Golden, Kennedy)
Knudson, Elizabeth, National and ethnic identity in Africa. (Firestone)
Kramer, Anne Devon, A L'Aube de l'Age Atomique, "Entre L'Enfer et La Raison." (Kennedy)
Radcliffe, Ben, Texture, practice, type scene: A stuy of iconicity in Homeric sacrifice. (Golden)
Sapp, Richie, Acutely disrupting the function of PirB enhances ocular dominance plasticity. (Firestone, Kennedy)
Shelley-Abrahamson, Seth, Hopf modules and representations of finite groups of lie type. (Firestone)
Trugman, Daniel T., A pseudo-dynamic rupture model generator for earthquakes on geometrically complex faults. (Firestone, Golden, Kennedy)
Vaid-Menon, Alok, Rainbows are just refracted white light: settler homonationalism in Neo-Apartheid. South Africa (Golden)
